St. Paul, Minn. , Oct. 12, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Device usage in healthcare continues to grow, and with it, a need to help integrate these devices into existing clinical workflow. In response, Ergotron, Inc., a global leader of ergonomic healthcare mounting and mobility solutions, has launched the SV10 series of its StyleView® Medical Carts, its lightest cart yet, for a wide array of laptops and tablets. In addition, one cart, the StyleView S-Tablet Cart SV10 was developed exclusively for Microsoft Surface and is compatible with all Surface devices. The SV10 series is the first new offering and collaborative design from Ergotron and Anthro Corporation engineering, since the acquisition earlier this year . 
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151009/275848 
"When it comes to quality patient care, proper device and equipment use has many challenges," said Bob Hill , Ergotron's healthcare industry manager. "If the necessary equipment doesn't fit within nurse's clinical workflow or is uncomfortable to work on, not only will EHR systems never reach their full potential, but it can also limit caregivers ability to execute their jobs and can ultimately impact the quality of care patients receive. By placing the technology in a format nurses already trust, such as Ergotron's StyleView Medical Cart line, those challenges are diminished, helping to ensure positive patient outcomes, and extending nurse comfort." 
Weighing just over 30 lbs. (15 kg), the SV10 cart has a patented lift engine that offers caregivers 15" (38 cm) of vertical travel for both seated and standing use. Its integrated hand-brake secures the platform height to provide an ultra-stable worksurface that is smooth and easy to clean. The t-slot channel interface on the cart's column allows for integration of accessories to customize a solution that's right for a variety of applications for both nurses and technicians. Ergotron's Add-on Power systems can be used to help power a tablet or laptop throughout a shift. 
"Nurses have been asking for a lightweight cart that would still offer all the features they love, but in an entirely smaller form factor," continued Hill. "With the SV10, hospitals and IT staff have a customizable solution that will address their growing device usage from a brand they already trust." 
The SV10 series will be debuted at the 2015 Cerner Health Conference in Kansas City . For more information Ergotron's SV10 carts and Ergotron's entire StyleView point of care line, visit Styleview.ergotron.com , Healthcare.ergotron.com or call 800.888.8458. 
About ErgotronErgotron, Inc. is a global manufacturer of leading digital display mounting, furniture, and mobility products that have been improving the human interface with digital displays for over 30 years. This history of innovation and passion for differentiation is evidenced in over 70 patents and a growing portfolio of award winning brands—OmniMount®, LearnFit™, StyleView®, TeachWell®, WorkFit™ and Neo-Flex® and ErgotronHome™—for computer monitors, notebooks, tablets, flat panel displays and TVs. Ergotron is headquartered in Saint Paul, Minnesota . Ergotron is a subsidiary of Nortek, Inc.(Nasdaq: NTK ), a global, diversified company whose many market-leading brands deliver broad capabilities and a wide array of innovative, technology-driven products and solutions for lifestyle improvement at home and at work.
